definition: erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]

sentences.english: Buddy, here I've got a cool game to show ya, it's called "Gangstas".
sentences.chinese: 哥们儿，我发现一款超好玩的游戏，叫“古惑仔”。

sentences.english: I don't want to dice with death by pissing off this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想招惹这哥们儿，自寻死路。

sentences.english: Hi, Monica, this is my number one buddy Ken.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，莫尼卡，这是我最好的哥们儿肯。

sentences.english: He's just a thoroughly good fella, it's as simple as that.
sentences.chinese: 他是个至真至诚的好哥们儿，就这么简单。

sentences.english: My mate Cally is up there with the best wingers I've ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 我的哥们儿卡利是我曾见过的最棒的边路球员。

sentences.english: Drew: Hey, what's up buddy? Did you see the Liverpool game on TV last night?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，怎么样，哥们儿，昨晚看利物浦队的比赛了吗？

sentences.english: But, if you’re a developer, oh boy, would I be unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 但如果你是个开发者，诶，哥们儿，我真替你难过。

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你爱上了自己铁哥们儿的前女友，而她也爱着你。

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex, and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你爱上了你铁哥们儿的前女友，而她也爱着你。

definition: Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
Nyima county, Tibetan: Nyi ma rdzong in Nagchu prefecture 那曲地區|那曲地区[Na4 qu3 di4 qu1], central Tibet
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
menfolk (collective term for men of different generations)/husbands and their fathers etc
